## {{< fa flask-vial >}} Labs

We worked on the next two labs ([solutions](/core/labs-solutions/) )

-   [Lab 1](/core/labs/lab-r-intro.html) - Introduction to R and RStudio
-   [Lab 2](/core/labs/lab-gapminder.html) - Introduction to Data Visualization using Gapminder dataset

We used [Rstudio](https://posit.co/download/rstudio-desktop/), created and initialized a dedicated  `R` project (without `git` and `renv`). We installed packages `tidyverse`, `pak` and `gapminder`. 

We reconstructed the [`gapminder`](/core/labs/lab-gapminder.qmd) demo using `ggplot2` and `plotly`. 

We went through several aspects of `R` following [Intro to `R`](/core/labs/lab-gapminder.qmd). This is an incentive to install packages `lobstr` and `rlang`. They can be very hepful when visualizing the data structures that underpin vectors, matrices, lists, and data frames.
